myself so when a team has their ways of working
dictated to them they often find themselves working against a process that
is is not optimized to how they want to work and how they need to work
this is the same as individuals and if you imagine you might have uh we often
see being authentic as an aspirational goal it's like i'd really like to be any think of a celebrity who just seems so
real you know it's like i'd love to be like them um but the thing is is obviously you can't
emulate someone else in order to be authentic and this is the same for teams you can't
emulate another team that seems to be doing really well because you know what they're probably doing really well because they're doing all of the right
things for them for their work for their context for what they're doing for their customers
and chances are i imagine very likely actually that unless you happen to be living in an
organization that has developed cloning technology there are different people in your team to the other team
and chances are their customers are probably even different even if they're internal customers you're probably
working on a different product to some degree hopefully you might not be because there is
dysfunction everywhere but you know we'll see what happens so the problem is is if we end up trying
to follow another team another team's process and what we end up being is is inauthentic we are
inauthentically following some other team in hope to get the same success that they are they are achieving
and what we end up doing is following the process but but not their process
you know as in our process their process the process but not their process and this is what i call contextual
misalignment it's really important as leaders and coaches to be guiding teams towards
contextual alignment and this does not mean telling them how to do the process or
telling them what process is the right process it is about guiding them to discovering
their own process and then importantly supporting them to discover and
rediscover what it might be over time because it won't be the same thing today as it is
in a couple of months time or even tomorrow

agile is not a method or a process these things emerge from teams truly working
